children.value: Find the velocity of the zero momentum frame relative to the laboratory frame.

By considering the collision in the zero momentum frame, show that in the laboratory frame the fraction of the initial kinetic energy transferred to $\vari{m_{2}}$ is given by

$$ \frac{4m_{1} m_{2}}{(m_{1}+m_{2})^{2}}. $$

Three balls of masses 
$\vari{m_{1}}$
, 
$\vari{m_{2}}$
 and 
$\vari{m_{3}}$
 are suspended in a horizontal line by light wires and are almost touching. The mass 
$\vari{m_{1}}$
 is given a horizontal velocity 
$\vari{v}$
 so that it collides head-on with the mass 
$\vari{m_{2}}$
.

answer.value: The kinetic energy of the final particle after both collisions is $\valuedef{E_k}{\frac{8 m_{1}^2 m_{2}^2 m_3 v^2}{(m_{1}+m_{2})^{2}(m_{2}+m_{3})^{2}}}{}$ , as shown in Figure 1 .
